author: pintail_xyz
content: Hi, thanks for following up and apologies for the silence. I think I've concluded that I don't have capacity for this at the moment. I'm still finishing a project on the fee market and the flashbots folks have suggested some further work which seems like a natural continuation. I think spec work will take me a while to get up to speed. Things also a bit hectic in personal life right now so I don't want to commit to anything I can't deliver. Sorry, should have said before and hope that I can contribute at some point in future!

author: samwilsn
content:
Hm, so I think I'm okay with a simplified approach:

```bash
cp -a src/ethereum/frontier src/ethereum/homestead
git add src/ethereum/homestead
git commit -m "Copy frontier to homestead"
```

As long as there is one commit where `homestead` is exactly equal to `frontier`, `git log --follow` seems to be able to show the full history.
